name: Raiment of the Seventh Veil
description: This fine robe has a large symbol made of six dull-colored veils tied end-to-end on the chest.
benefit: You're able to see through the effects of the Mirror Image spell.
additional: You can cast Mirror Image once per day (+4 bonus).

name: High Harbinger's Robes
description: These blood stained robes bear a putrid stench that hangs about them like an aura of death.
additional: You may cast two Tier 1 spells with one action.

name: Spider Silk Robe
description: Woven from the silk of the dreaded phase spider, it's miraculous creation baffles even the most seasoned tailors.
benefit: Physical damage is reduced by 1 point.

name: Starlit Robe
description: This somber set of robes is flecked with bright, shimmering points of white, in imitation of a starry night sky.
benefit: Hostile spells targeting the wearer are DC13 (minimum) to cast.

name: Rebel's Call
description: With a golden bell emblem on the chest, this reinforced leather armor has heavy wear and tear.
benefit: Damage rolls increased by 1 for every ally within half near.
additional: You can cast Shield of Faith once per day (+4 bonus).

name: Fleshmender
description: This armor is made of cured deer leather of a most peculiar variety, a pure white buck with no visible wounds or scarring.
benefit: Physical damage is reduced by 1 point.
additional: You can cast Cure Wounds once per day (+4 bonus).

name: Cabalist's Gambeson
description: In the company of ruthless wizards, this enchanted gambeson offered a measure of security.
additional: Elemental damage is reduced by 3 point.

name: Wayfarer's Cuirass
description: Comissioned by a dwarven explorer, this cuirass enhances the wearer's stamina and allows swift movement in times of need.
benefit: Regenerate 1 hit point each round of combat.
additional: You can cast Haste once per day (+4 bonus).

name: Iridescent Chainmail
description: This chainmail shifts hues of green, blue, white, and red that hint to powerful protective magic.
benefit: Elemental damage is reduced by 3 points.

name: Wyrmwull
description: A dragon hunter in Urgir commissioned this armor to protect himself from slashing claws and fiery breath. Sadly, he was killed by marauding orcs.
additional: Slashing and fire damage is reduced by 3 points.

name: The Bloody Links
description: This suit of mail seems to constrict and relax with the rhythm of a heartbeat. The armor has been worn by numerous warriors in countless battles.
benefit: Dealing damage with melee weapons restores 1 hit point.
additional: You can cast False Life once per day (+4 bonus).

name: Hearth Defender's Mail
description: This magnificent chainmail is in remarkable shape, once the wearer speaks the name of those closest to them a magical bond is formed.
benefit: All damage is reduced by 1 for every ally (spoken) within half of near.

name: Plate of Ill Payment
description: This plate mail helps lash out to those who would harm the wearer, enabling quick counter strikes.
benefit: If hit within close you may counter attack once per round.

name: Sanguine Plate
description: Despite popular assumption, this plate was not named for its blood-spattered appearance. It derives from the lust of bloodshed needed to satiate the wearer.
benefit: Dealing damage with melee weapons restores 1 hit point.
additional: You can cast Vampiric Touch once per day (+4 bonus).

name: Blackend Plate
description: This dark steel suit of armor looks eerily familiar. It bears a strange maker's mark resembling a jawless skull.
benefit: All damage is reduced by 1 point.
additional: When struck by a critical you and your allies within near heal 1d6 hit points.

name: One Dozen Stood
description: Blackened and scored, this heavy plate bears the mark of a master metalworker. Flames grace the breastplate and pauldrons.
benefit: Melee weapons deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.
additional: Enemies within double close must succeed a DC12 strength check in order to pass you.
